<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Battle Planner](/Feats.aspx?ID=2112) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 203 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8)

</column>

---

You are constantly drawing up plans and battle scenarios, assembling strategies and gathered intelligence for later use. When you scout an enemy's position or receive a detailed report from an ally who scouted the enemy's position, if you have a clear indication of the number, position, and identities of your potential foes, you can spend 1 minute to come up with a battle plan that takes such potential factors into account and reduces the role luck plays in the equation. Roll a [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) check. As long as the information was accurate and remains accurate when you roll initiative against those enemies, you can use the Warfare Lore result you previously rolled for your initiative roll; if you do, this is a [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76) effect.
name: Battle Planner
